results.title: Union at work: this is TWUA
results.creator_credit: Lawrence Rogin, Rosemarie Hickson, Albert Hemsing and Textile Workers Union of America
results.brief_description: The official story of the Textile Workers Union of America. Working through 800 locals, involving a membership of 450,000, the union carries out an extensive program of work bringing many benefits to its members. Filmed in the mills, on the picket lines, in union halls and in the homes of members, the film not only underlines the benefits of union membership but also stresses the rights and obligations of working people everywhere. Narrated by Joseph Julian.

results.title: Unfinished business: the Japanese American internment cases
results.brief_description: This compelling documentary film tells the true story of three Japanese Americans who refused to let themselves be put into the internment camps which were being established across the US in the Spring of 1942. Gordon Hirabayashi, Fred Korematsu and Minoru Yasui courageously defied the government and were separately convicted and imprisoned for violating Executive Order 9066. The film interweaves the personal stories of the three men with startling archival footage of war-time anti-Japanese hysteria, the evacuation and incarceration, and life in the camps. It captures them today, now fighting to overturn their original convictions in the final round of a 40 year-old battle against the act which shattered the lives of two generations of Japanese Americans. (Award: Winner 1984 Cine Golden Eagle)

results.title: Une Si Jolie Petite Plage = Such a Pretty Little Beach
results.brief_description:
Pierre registers at a dismal hotel in a desolate seaside resort in Normandy. He had worked there as a kitchen hand some years before and run off with a famous singer, who has just been found dead. He is supected by a mysterious fellow guest of having committed a crime of passion. Instead of finding peace in the village were he grew up, Pierre is driven to desparation by the grotesque pettiness of the local townsfolk, the duplicity of friends and so-called loved ones and the relentlessly rotten weather.

Credits: Producer, Emile Darbon ; director, Yves Allegret ; writer, Jacques Sigurd ; photography, Henri Alekan ; music, Maurice Thiriet.
Cast: Madeleine Robinson, Gerard Philippe, Jane Marken, Jean Servais, Julien Carette, Mona Dol, Andre Valmy.

results.title: Une Fee Pas Comme les Autres
results.brief_description:
A young fairy entrusts her magic wand to a friend for safe keeping. Alas, a lover she once rebuffed decides to appropriate the precious wand and destroy the country protected by the fairy. Meanwhile a village preparations are afoot to receive, Barbara the famous singer, for an evening of unforgettable musical entertainment. Saturnin and a group of villagers must battle to retrieve the magic wand from evil hands and save their village. This children’s film is cast with live animals.

Credits: Producer, Pierre Bochart ; director, Jean Tourane ; writers, Louise de Villemorin, Jean Tourane, R. Lavigne ; photography, Maurice Fellous ; music, Richard Cornu.
Cast: Robert Lamoureux [narration].

results.title: Une Cite Pas Comme les Autres
results.brief_description:
La Cite Universitaire de Paris’ is made up of 37 halls of residence, housing 5000 students, 70% of whom are international students. This documentary filmed in the 1970s details the philosophy of the Cite Universitaire through interviews with past and present managers as well as residents, including Senegal President L. Senghor and Henri, Prince of Denmark.

Credits: Director, Jean-Luc Magneron ; photography, Claude Mathe.

results.title: Understanding sexuality (with booklet)
results.brief_description: An educational video with accompanying booklet featuring Professor Derek Llewellyn-Jones, professor of obstetrics and gynaecology at the University of Sydney discussing subjects such as sexuality, puberty, menstruation, sexual behaviour, contraception, pregnancy and abortion, sexual diseases and sexual responsibility with a group of adolescents.

results.title: Understanding movies
results.brief_description: Presents a study of motion picture technique through excerpts from the MGM films: Tennessee Johnson, The Good Earth, Treasure Island, David Copperfield and, Romeo and Juliet. Highlights directing, acting, photography and editing as well as art and music. All excerpts from pictures produced and copyrighted by Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer.

results.title: Understanding Herbal Medicine
results.brief_description: This program is a practical guide to basic herbal medicine. Common herbs are listed and their therapeutic qualities are described. An informative guide to alternative remedies for everyday health problems.

results.title: Understanding color: color by addition
results.brief_description: The basic principles governing the addition of primary colors of light are explored. The film shows how the different hues of colored light are produced. In a special color television sequence, we see the best known example of color by addition.

results.title: Understanding Auslan
results.brief_description: This video is an instructional and entertaining look at the different types of sign language which exist around the world. It explains the development of Auslan - Australian Sign Language - in Australia, why there are variations in signing between states and countries and generations, the grammatical differences between Auslan and English, and a basic introduction to Auslan. The video is presented with a voiceover and subtitles for the hearing impaired.
